message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.CC. 

The problem studied in this paper involves finding a set of closed curves that enclose a given set of points in the plane, while minimizing the total length of the curves. This is a classic problem in computational geometry, and is typically studied in the cs.CG (Computational Geometry) sub-category. The paper also presents algorithms that are polynomial or near-linear in the input size, which suggests that it may involve techniques from cs.DS (Data Structures), cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics), or cs.CC (Computational Complexity). Finally, the problem of finding the minimum number of curves to enclose a set of points is related to the concept of graph partitioning, which is studied in the cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) sub-category.
